Articles.Content:
Ehh nvm this.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-08-15T01:06:01Z" title="08/15/2015 01:06  AM" data-short="8 yr">August 15, 2015</time> by \_Augustus\_**

Check out the [Chaka Monkey](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/64993-0-90-Chaka-Monkey-Exploration-Odyssey-0-27-1-EFT-1-Commemorative-Edition?highlight=chaka+monkey) parts, you'll find there almost everything.

There are a few good KSP focused modelling tutorials on the forum to get you started.

[Here's one for Blender.](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/24742)

[And ~ shameless plug ~ here's my tutorial for Wings 3D (Including texturing)](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/entries/3232-Part-Modding-Tutorial-1-4-Modeling)

If not to model them yourself, you could try taking the models from Orbiter (Which I believe are free to use, though you should be careful). There's a few tools available in the Orbiter community to convert the models to KSP friendly formats.

[Here's some constellation stuff.](http://www.orbithangar.com/searchid.php?ID=1957)

Best of luck!

**Edited <time datetime="2015-03-29T16:20:05Z" title="03/29/2015 04:20  PM" data-short="9 yr">March 29, 2015</time> by Beale**

Most Orbiter models do in fact have...interesting...licensing. I would not suggest that as route. The tutorials are great though! Augustus, I highly, *highly* recommend just taking some time and learning this stuff. It can be fun, and you'll get much more of a sense of accomplishment.

> 
> Most Orbiter models do in fact have...interesting...licensing. I would not suggest that as route.

Ah apologies for that. My only experience with Orbiter add-on licencing was for a Space: 1999 model, which I recall was CC (Or one of the more permissive licences).

Yeah, Orbiter is probably not a good route to go with this ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
